subject: Refactoring threshold properties code.
commitMessage:
Refactoring threshold properties code.

Multiple threshold interfaces like Hardshutdown and Softshutdown
needs to be created for sensors. Therefore, array has been created
to store multiple properties of thresholds.

Threshold level, direction and properties can be accessed based on
the array created. Moreover, lines of code has been reduced by
refactoring existing threshold code.

TESTED: Tested on Facebook YosemiteV2 hardware. Verified that the
Warning and Critical interfaces and properties are created and
displaying in dbus objects.

Signed-off-by: Jayashree Dhanapal <jayashree-d@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I98be6dd723a6f66336147ec572f161a6c5df3691

Hi All,

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments.

Thanks.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Hi Jayashree - I think cleaning up this code is certainly a good idea. I have some reservations about how you've gone about it though. While the original code was not very data-driven, the approaches implemented in this patch seem pretty heavy in places. Anyway, some comments inline.

Patch Set 3:

(6 comments)

Hi Andrew,

Thanks for reviewing this patch, As I mentioned in the commit message, threshold interfaces for Hardshutdown and Softshutdown needs to be added. Hence, these codes have been refactored and assigned to map. The following patchset also submitted in gerrit to avoid duplicating functions.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/49538.

If you have any other suggestions, I am open to the idea and will refactor the code in the best way.

Change has been successfully merged
This also can be converted to switch case or map lookup to enhance ?  If we add shutdown interfaces, then 'if, else if' part will be increased.
Done
Feels a bit bananas that we store another shared pointer to our own member.
Ack
Is there a better way to do this? These maps have 2 or so entries in them.
Ack, For sensor-monitor feature, HardShutdown and SoftShutdown interface are needs to be added. Therefore, this map has been created to store more than 2 entries.

Why not this?

 alarm = thresholdName[threshold.level] + "Alarm" + directionName[threshold.direction];
Ack
Do all of this in the constructor?
yes, this will be set in the constructor.
Ack
Provide a helper function?
Ack
Another helper function for this one too.
Ack

These seem like they could be a constexpr array, right?


Making them constexpr would significantly reduce the runtime memory usage of these.
Done
Why is there a separate map for direction?
This is converted to std::array and it will represent HIGH or LOW based on the threshold direction.

You've ignored the constexpr part.  I would like these tables not to be allocated at runtime.

Also, I'm really not following why we need two tables.  The threshold level can be present in two rows, that seems fine, but sure, if you want to split them up, I guess that's ok too, I just think it's more confusing to read.
In latest patchset, I have used 1 table and also defined array using constexpr static.
Done
These can be easily set as a constexpr, given that they're fixed.
Done
operator[] creates an entry if it's not found, which is definitely not what you want here.
Done
change to const char* or std::string_view to make these constexpr constructable.
Done

Please make these constexpr static so they're not allocated for every single sensor.  As written, this will allocate memory  for every single sensor that's instantiated, when this table is in fact constexpr.  This was pointed out in the previous comment.
Done
Done
Same as above.
Done
This structure has exactly the same comments as the previous.  I suspect it would be much simpler as a single table, needs to be constexpr, and needs to index into it properly.
Done
Ack
Same comments as before, except that this is much worse, given that we're using user input here.
Done
Please make these enum class, such that we don't have to unintentionally namespace DERROR and LERROR.
Done
Why -1?  Nothing about -1 is important to this enum, right?
Ack
please make explicit type here.  This as written is making a copy of the structure, which I'm assuming is not what you intended.
Done
same here.
Done

Can these two items be combined with the threshProp structure?  They both seem to have 4 members, and contain the exact same lookups, so it would seem to make sense that we should put them all together, and reduce the table duplication.
Done
Magic numbers.
Done
